      • setParent

        public void setParent(Entity parent)
        Description copied from interface: Entity
        Updates the parent of this entity.
        This method makes sure that the old and the new parent keep their entities list updated, by automatically calling Entity.addEntity(Entity) and Entity.removeEntity(Entity).

        A CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED notification is thrown.
        Additionally, each descendant of this entity (ie: entities who have this entity as their direct or not direct parent) are notified using CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_ANCESTOR_CHANGED.

        Specified by:
        setParent in interface Entity
        Overrides:
        setParent in class EntityImpl

      • computeStorageScore

        public double computeStorageScore(StorageFile storageFile,
                         Storage storage)
        Computes and returns a score indicating the level of compliancy of the given storage towards the storage file's constraints.

        A return value of 0.0d or less indicates that the host does not comply (at all). And the storageFile cannot be placed on that storage.

        If this method returns Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY then the given storage produces the highest matching score for the given storageFile.

        This method takes care of the FailureProneEntity.FailureState of the storage and its parent host.

        This method does not take care of the PoweredEntity.PowerState of the parent host of the storage.

        Parameters:
        storageFile -
        storage -
        Returns:
        computed score for placing the given storageFile on the given storage

      • selectStorage

        public Storage selectStorage(StorageFile storageFile,
                    List<Host> hosts,
                    List<Host> excludedHosts)
        Description copied from interface: SfPlacementPolicy
        Selects a host and a storage where to place the given storageFile and returns that storage.

        A storage among all available storages will be selected such that it has enough space to save the given storageFile.

        Among other conditions, the selected storage and its parent host must be in FailureProneEntity.FailureState.OK state. But, the parent host can be in a state other than PoweredEntity.PowerState.ON if the cloud provider's power manager allows it to be powered on. In which case, it is left to the placement method to power it on.

        Depending on whether a storage was found or not, a NotificationCodes.SFP_STORAGESELECTION_SUCCESS or NotificationCodes.SFP_STORAGESELECTION_FAILED is thrown.

        Specified by:
        selectStorage in interface SfPlacementPolicy
        hosts - possible hosts. May be null in which case, all hosts in the cloud are considered.
        excludedHosts - a list of hosts that should not be selected. May be null.
        Returns:
        the selected storage or null if no storage was found

      • canPlaceStorageFile

      • placeStorageFile

        public void placeStorageFile(StorageFile storageFile,
                    Storage storage)
        Description copied from interface: SfPlacementPolicy
        Takes all actions in order to place the given storageFile on the given storage. When all actions were taken, the storageFile's parent is updated.
        You need to listen to the CoreNotificationCodes.ENTITY_PARENT_CHANGED to know when the placement has ended, as it may not be the case when this method returns.

        The parent host of the given storage may be in another state than PoweredEntity.PowerState.ON. If so then this method asks the cloud provider's power manger to power it on.

        You need to check for the return value of SfPlacementPolicy.canPlaceStorageFile(StorageFile, Storage) to see if the storageFile can be placed on the given storage.
        If you selected the storage using SfPlacementPolicy.selectStorage(StorageFile) then this method should succeed.

        Specified by:
        placeStorageFile in interface SfPlacementPolicy
        Parameters:
        storageFile - the StorageFile to place
        storage - the Storage where to place the storageFile

      • unplaceStorageFile

        public void unplaceStorageFile(StorageFile storageFile)
        Description copied from interface: SfPlacementPolicy
        Takes all actions in order to unplaces the given storageFile.
        When all actions were taken, the StorageFile's parent is updated (set to null).

        The parent host of the storageFile's Storage should be powered off if the cloud provider's power manger allows it to.

        Specified by:
        unplaceStorageFile in interface SfPlacementPolicy
